abstract: This essay develops a new human right derived from both domestic substantive due process and international political exit right doctrines, called the primary right, which is best described as a general human claim-right of reasonable access to wilderness. It is a first generation human rights approach to environmental protection, positing a nonhuman baseline environment which is a necessary condition for persons to a) be let alone by others, and b) withdraw consent to political association and exit any, and therefore all, polities.
title: What Is the Primary Right?
subject: law
